data.name: Double IPA
data.description: Celebrate Hops! This beauty is packed full of hop flavor and all things hops. Chill to cellar temp 52-54 F Pour into a Rock Art pint glass with a generous head, grasp with authority and indulge yourself with hops. SLOW FOODS experience, pair this with an extra sharp cheddar and a spicy venison chili. For the surf lover, try scallops sautéed in butter and garlic, served on a bed of linguine and pink Alfredo sauce with a side of roasted sweet red peppers and asparagus tips. Maybe add some zip to your favorite chef’s salad. Whether it’s 90 degrees out or your knee deep in pow pow.....

style.name: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
style.description: Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma. Alcohol content is medium-high to high and notably evident. They range from deep golden to medium copper in color. The style may use any variety of hops. Though the hop character is intense it's balanced with complex alcohol flavors, moderate to high fruity esters and medium to high malt character. Hop character should be fresh and lively and should not be harsh in quality. The use of large amounts of hops may cause a degree of appropriate hop haze. Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have medium-high to full body. Diacetyl should not be perceived. The intention of this style of beer is to exhibit the fresh and bright character of hops. Oxidative character and aged character should not be present.

breweries.name: Rock Art Brewery
breweries.description:
Matt began the brewery in the basement of our home in 1997. Wow! I can't believe I let him do that! His first beer was Whitetail Ale. A nice crisp refreshing golden ale. I was really enjoying wheat beers at the time. I guess that's why I let him start Rock Art! The Brewery was ready to leave home and move to it's own place down the road in Morrisville, VT in 2001. We are still located there and now have a terrific space for people to come and visit. Come on by and say hello!

Our Mission is to offer our friends and family a wonderful beer at the end of the day!

breweries.name: Midtfyns Bryghus
breweries.description: Micro brewery Midtfyns Brewery was founded in the fall of 2004, and the first beer was launched in March 2005. In the beginning  the beer was brewed under license from Scotland. When Eddie Szweda took over the management of the brewery in November 2006, he undertook radical changes for the small brewery in Brobyværk. Production was changed and a line of new and exciting beers developed by the brewery itself.

data.name: Double IPA
data.description: Our Double IPA packs a strong punch and never loses the delicate characteristics of a traditional IPA. This brew pours a golden, chestnut brown and has a distinct, fruity hop aroma that compliments its lively and fresh flavor. Citrus and floral notes blend with a slight caramel maltiness. The Double IPA was created in England to withstand long travel to its colonies. Today, we’re only worried about the distance from the tap to your glass!

breweries.name: Blowing Rock Brewery
breweries.description:
The Blowing Rock Brewery and Ale House Restaurant is located in downtown Blowing Rock. A state-of-the-art brewing system consists of a 5 barrel Mash Tun, Brew Kettle and 10 barrel Fermenters & Brights . The brewery offers an impressive variety of craft beers brewed by master brewer, Ray Hodge. The Blowing Rock Ale House restaurant offers a freshly prepared, seasonally changing menu using local & organic ingredients when available. 64 ounce “growler” fills of freshly brewed beer are offered daily, with brewery tours 1:00-5:30pm Saturdays. We hope you will join us for lunch & dinner, 11am-9pm.

152 Sunset Drive
Blowing Rock, NC 28605-1236
Telephone: 828-414-9600 
http://blowingrockbrewing.com/

data.name: Double IPA
data.description: Here you go hopheads – we brewed this one just for you!!  55+ pounds of hops, lots of local honey and a little citrus just for some added kick. Golden in color with a nice rounded malt middle, ending with a huge punch of hop bitterness.  Get it while it lasts because it won’t be around for long!

breweries.name: Saint Archer Brewing Company
breweries.description: Saint Archer Brewing Company was founded on a unique strain of creative talent: World-class brewers. Artists and musicians. Surfers, skateboarders, and snowboarders…. All coming together with passion and commitment to express our collective true love — handcrafted beer. Saint Archer's been a long time in the tank and we hope you taste our appreciation and gratitude in every sip.

breweries.name: SunUp Brewing
breweries.description:
The seven barrel system that looms behind the floor to ceiling glass in our Brewer’s Den is the fruits of our labor and February 14, 2006 marked a new chapter in our history. You see, this was the day that the first three beers brewed on site flowed. We know we are biased, but in our minds the beer had never tasted as good as it did that day. Our brew master is the “Big German” Uwe Boer that we all know and love. He works magic in his craft and the passion that he shows for brewing fills the glasses as his award winning beer dispenses from our taps. We now boast our own regular taps but his innovation in our seasonal ales and distinct brewing style is what keeps our bar stools full and the place hopping. We can hardly keep his cask conditioned ale on tap as our customers are known to consume the kegs in record time.

“Great Beer, Great Food and Great Service” became our motto as we plugged through the first few years and now the slogan is what we live by. Our fantastic customers and great staff are what makes us who we are and how we stand out in the sea of new restaurants that pop up daily. It is our great customers that made it so easy to push forward into brewing and our loyal staff that helped to smooth over the transition. We continue to grow and change over time just as any business wants to do but it is remembering the little things that have gotten us to where we are today. After all in today’s crazy hectic world it is the little things in life that make it all worth it.

data.name: Double IPA
data.description: 2 row malt makes this beer clean, crisp, and dry. Crystal 60 adds the color to this “pale ale.” The Apollo and Crystal hops are aggressive and dominant, resulting in a strong citrus/pine flavor. The light earthy spice comes from the Amarillo, Sterling, and Northern Brewer hops.

breweries.name: Sunset Reservoir Brewing Company
breweries.description: Outer Sunset's newest family-friendly restaurant and brewery.

data.name: Double IPA
data.description: It is every bryggares dream is to combine such large amounts of malt and hops in this sturdy double IPA. The style was invented in the United States in the 2000s by a few pioneers who wanted to bring the IPA to even greater heights when it comes to malt body, hops aromas and hop bitterness. Our DIPA is an exercise in the art of combining karamellig malt and yeast with massive fruity hops.

breweries.name: Sigtuna Brygghus
breweries.description:
Sigtuna Brygghus arrived in 2005 at ölentusiasterna Peter Forss ', David Meadows ' and Dan Lundgren's initiative. With their history as leading personalities since the 1980s behind the new Swedish ölboomen project was a unique experience.

Sigtuna Brygghus ' beer was originally the luxurious new interpretations of historical ölstilar and they made quick success. The small-budgeted production was exceeded after only one year.

With inspiration from American craft beer a la New York and Boston was launched, among others, the East River and East Coast Pale Ale, which in a short time have become bestsellers in Sweden with microbrewery standards.

From 2009 to 2011, when the brewery with the help of partner Galateas investment could be expanded, sexdubblades sales. Sigtuna Brygghus sped up as one of the biggest brands in Swedish hantverksöl.

The product portfolio, with both delightfully flavorful session beer that exciting experimentbrygder, has made itself a reputation internationally and in several exhibitions. Not least through many awards at Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival in recent years.

In the fixed range includes 3 stock and ale, all available at Systembolaget. Each year brewed a wide selection of seasonal and specialty beers, which won prizes and a warm reception.

Discover Sigtuna Brygghus ' beer so you can understand why.

breweries.name: New American Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Our story starts in the kitchen of David Bryan circa 2006.  That's when the first batches of home-brewed beer began appearing and David's wife Lori began to realize that her husband was forming a lifetime passion.  David's passion would continue to grow and evolve.  He learned the tradition of brewing in America.  The history of small family owned breweries that we able to serve fresh handcrafted beer to their local communities.  The fact that the these small local breweries became points of pride in the community and that the businesses would stay in the family for generations.  
 
An idea began to grow.  The idea that despite the brewing world we live in now with mega breweries pumping out mass marketed bland beer, that a small locally owned brewery making fresh unique beer could again be a source of pride for a community.  David dreamed of recreating this American brewing tradition and so set out on his way to do just that.
 
David spent the next 7 years honing his craft.  Learning about beer styles and brewing techniques.  Winning contests with his beer and defining a unique style for quality and consistency.  In 2012 the wheels were set into motion for our brewery when David met Tyler Meusburger, a colleague with a passion for entrepreneurship and creativity.  Working together they began building a business plan and putting financing into place, and in Nov of 2013 David and Tyler brewed the first batch of beer at New American Brewing Co.
 
We look forward to continuing our story and living a "New Tradition" of American brewing.
 
Drink American!

data.name: DOUBLE IPA
data.description: A full bodied citrus flavored Double IPA that is Extremely Hoppy but still has that same smooth clean finish that you will find in all of our brews!

breweries.description: Forged in 1995, AleSmith is an artisan microbrewery that specializes in handcrafted ales in a variety of styles. Deeply rooted in the amateur and craft brewing communities, AleSmith ales have continued to garner national and international awards and acclaim, as well as a loyal and rabid following among beer enthusiasts.

breweries.description: Climbing Bines Craft Ale Company is one of New York State's first farm breweries! We specialize in small batch, hand-crafted ales brewed on site with the freshest, estate-grown hops and barley harvested just a few miles down the road.

breweries.name: Deepwater Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Deep Water Brewing Co. is our very own three barrel microbrewery.  While the actual brewery is currently off site in Brooklin, it will soon be located behind the Arborvine.

At Deep Water we personally handcraft each and every beer from the best ingredients available. Right now, we serve our beers exclusively at the Arborvine and the Vinery.

Being small allows us to experiment. We brew a number of styles and try to keep them rotating throughout the summer.

Primarily, we brew ales, namely: Pale Ale, Double IPA, Amber Ale, Porter, Oatmeal Stout (coming soon), and British mild.

For special occasions, though, we have been known to break out a keg of lager or two.  In the past we've served: Bohemian Pilsner and Octoberfest (Marzen).  Sometime this summer we will debut our Vienna Lager.

data.name: Double IPA
data.description: Our Double IPA is handcrafted for the well-traveled craft beer enthusiast using Pale Ale, Munich, and Caramalt to achieve an original gravity of 19 Plato. The hop bill consists of a Magnum, Cascade, and Summit used at different times in the boil as well as dry hopping.

breweries.name: Navigation Brewing Company
breweries.description: Our passion is brewing quality handcrafted ales.

data.name: Double IPA
data.description:
Assertive and drinkable. Double IPA is California’s gift to beer lovers. Ours is brewed with four distinctly American hops: Centennial, Citra, Columbus and Simcoe, all beautifully balanced by five malts and generous additions of local orange blossom honey. An intense sensory experience — the fresh aroma of citrus, pine and grapefruit with the bold taste of hops and sweet honey.

This beer was first brewed to celebrate American Craft Beer Week in 2010. The Double IPA style is distinctly American, and so are the flavors of the specific hops used. This beer was an instant hit (Southern Californians do love their hops!) and we plan on brewing it throughout the year whenever our production schedule allows it.
data.foodPairings: Grilled lamb, smoked beef brisket, chicken fried steak. Crème brulee. Sharp blue cheeses.

breweries.name: Hangar 24 Craft Brewery
breweries.description: Hangar 24 Craft Brewery began with a true passion for good beer, the absolute love of flying and the pure enjoyment of being around great friends. Founder and Master Brewer Ben Cook and his buddies used to meet at hangar 24 after an afternoon of flying to trade stories, talk aviation, play music and share a few cold ones that Ben just finished brewing at home. These days, the location of where these fine beers are brewed has changed, but the quality time spent enjoying a delicious, handcrafted beer and conversation with friends is the same as ever. Cheers.

Providing beers that range from historical, to contemporary, to the avant-garde, each batch of beer is carefully brewed by hand, and left unfiltered for an exceptional depth of flavor.

breweries.name: Mill & Main Brewing Company
breweries.description: In a town said to have been built around beer, we are Jefferson County's first brewery to open in over 120 years. We have worked diligently, renovating and expanding our building into a new gathering place for our community. The brewery features a rustic family-friendly dining room and patio offering American pub food on the main floor as well as a second-story tasting room and bar complete with a deck. Open daily and pouring seven rotating handcrafted seasonal and year-round draft selections from our brewhouse.

data.name: Double IPA
data.description: Propeller Double IPA is a full bodied, American style Double India Pale Ale that is brewed with premium Pacific Northwest hops and a rich blend of 2-row Pale and Crystal malts. Following fermentation it has been heavily dry hopped (a process that enhances the aroma without imparting bitterness in beer) giving this bold brew its big west coast nose. Double IPA delivers a huge amount of piney, floral, and citrusy hop aroma and flavor from start to finish that is balanced by sweet malt flavors. At 8.2% alcohol by volume and 85 IBUs, Propeller Double IPA is not for everyone… It is a TRUE hop bomb, for TRUE hopheads.

breweries.name: Propeller Brewery
breweries.description: Propeller Brewing Company is Nova Scotia’s best selling microbrewery. Our International award winning, all-natural, British-style ales and lagers are available at liquor stores, fine bars and restaurants throughout Nova Scotia. Ask for an Extra Special Bitter or an India Pale Ale, the Province's two best selling micro brewed beers, or drop by the downtown brewery and retail store to sample brewery fresh craft ales.

data.description: A local hopped Black Double IPA, released just in time to pull you out of the winter blues, kick the frost off the ground and signify the start of the planting season. Keep an eye out for this seasonal brew hitting the taps the first day of spring!

breweries.name: Adirondack Pub & Brewery
breweries.description: All of our craft-brewed beers are made on the premises using only the finest malt, hops, yeast and water. We currently produce these beers on a 15-barrel Bohemian copper brewhouse. Our fermantation capacity is 60 barrels (1,860 gallons), with an even larger serving capacity in our cold cellars. We invite you to taste hand-crafted beer at its finest. Look for Adirondack Pub & Brewery's hand-crafted beers at great establishments throughout New York State.

data.name: Double IPA
data.description: Just like the name implies, brewing a batch of pFriem Double IPA takes twice the regular amount of malt and hops. That means each pint is brimming with doubly-rich aromas of fresh berries, notes of papaya and a malty sweetness. Just make sure to raise your glasses twice because a beer like this deserves a double cheers.
data.foodPairings: Rich and hearty burgers, French fries and complex pizzas.  Aged cheddar cheese, aged meats, and pickled vegetables.  Indian cuisine that is spice forward balanced yogurt and cream based sauces.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
style.description: Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma. Alcohol content is medium-high to high and notably evident. They range from deep golden to medium copper in color. The style may use any variety of hops. Though the hop character is intense it's balanced with complex alcohol flavors, moderate to high fruity esters and medium to high malt character. Hop character should be fresh and lively and should not be harsh in quality. The use of large amounts of hops may cause a degree of appropriate hop haze. Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have medium-high to full body. Diacetyl should not be perceived. The intention of this style of beer is to exhibit the fresh and bright character of hops. Oxidative character and aged character should not be present.

breweries.name: Pfriem Family Brewers
breweries.description: A Northwest & Belgian inspired 15-barrel brewery and tasting room serving lunch and dinner 7 days a week in Hood River, OR.  pFriem artisanal beers are symphonies of flavor and balance, influenced by the great brewers of Belgium, but unmistakably true to our homegrown roots in the Pacific Northwest. Although they are served humbly, each glass is overflowing with pride and a relentless aspiration to brew the best beer in the world. We’ll let you decide.

breweries.name: Black Bridge Brewery
breweries.description:
Our philosophies are simple; complete disclosure and honesty in business, how we make our beer and where our ingredients come from.
We believe strongly in not compromising our beer for profit, ever- and will strive to foster a culture of appreciation for finely crafted beer.
BLACK BRIDGE BREWERY welcomes you to stop by and sample our beer. Our three flagship beers are now available plus seasonal beers throughout the year.

style.name: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
style.description: Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma. Alcohol content is medium-high to high and notably evident. They range from deep golden to medium copper in color. The style may use any variety of hops. Though the hop character is intense it's balanced with complex alcohol flavors, moderate to high fruity esters and medium to high malt character. breweries.name: Red Brick Brewing Company
breweries.description:
As the southeast's oldest brewery, Red Brick recently celebrated their 20th Anniversary. This milestone not only exemplifies their continuing commitment to amazing craft beer, but also signals a shift in focus for the brewery towards more innovative recipes and concepts.

Headed up by a small group of impassioned beer lovers including head brewer Garett Lockhart, Red Brick is determined to lead the charge in the south, putting out excellent beers such as "Hoplanta" IPA and the upcoming winter release "Sacred Cow" chai milk stout. They also take time to push the limits of brewing with the "Brick Mason" series, which the staff sees as their continuing masterpiece. Highlights from this series include "The Lost Years" old ale, "Black-Eye Rye" American black ale, and the most recent release "20th Anniversary", a 10% Imperial stout that was aged in Buffalo Trace bourbon barrels. Early accolades have already compared it to the hallowed KBS.

The future keeps looking brighter and brighter for this brewery, and the next couple years will see them growing and experimenting with diverse styles, collaborating with fellow breweries, implementing a new barrel program, and continuing to raise the bar for themselves in all aspects. After all, craft beer isn't just a product; it's a journey.

data.name: Double IPA
data.description: West Coast style with hop intensity.  CTZ, Centennial and Cascade create the citrus spice that shine in this palate-scrubbing ale.  Dry hopping with CTZ and Centennial adds to the robust flavor and bitterness.
data.foodPairings: Aged Cheddar, Cotswold; Korean-style Grilled Beef Short Ribs

Our goal is to create distinctive beers for active individuals who can’t just stand on the sidelines. Enjoy Strike’s unique session beers with friends in conversation and celebration. These beers were brewed to reward hard work and fuel the “fire within.”

data.name: Double IPA
data.description: We created this recipe to showcase, first and foremost, the hops. This beer has a strong hop aroma with a long bitter finish.

breweries.name: Canton Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Canton Brewing Company’s Speakeasy tap room is open for business and features a great lineup of beers all brewed right here in our very own brewery. When you visit the Speakeasy you’ll be tasting the traditions of Canton’s premier brewer, dating all the way back to the 1880s. Many of our beers are based on the historical styles for which we were originally known. But we also know you love the new traditions being created in craft brewing so we have plenty of those too. You’ll enjoy tasting amidst the very brewing equipment we use everyday! The restaurant is now open for dinner only for now. We're open T-Th 4 pm - 10 pm and Fri-Sat from 4 pm - 11 pm. The kitchen closes one hour early, but pizzas only will be served until closing. We will post our menu soon.

data.name: Double IPA
data.description: Our Double India Pale Ale is bigger in hop character and alcohol than our Extra Pale Ale. It is sure to please even the most discerning hop-head! Also known as Imperial IPA, this intensely hoppy, yet very drinkable beer lets the malty characteristics take a step back and allows the hops to really shine. Brewed with almost two (2) pounds of hops per barrel and left unfiltered, Six Row Double IPA showcases the citrusy and piney characteristics of the Columbus, Centennial, and Chinook hops. Double IPA is served in a 10oz snifter.

breweries.name: Six Row Brewing Company
breweries.description: Six Row Brewing Company produces quality ales from the site of the old Falstaff Brewery at 3690 Forest Park Ave., in the Midtown area of St. Louis, near St. Louis University. Our Old Plant No. 1 Pub is open to the public and features our craft brewed beers along with selections from other craft breweries and wineries. Stop by and enjoy a pint soon! Then, take home a growler to enjoy one of St. Louis' finest craft beers till your next visit!

breweries.name: Rough Draft Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We like beer. And word on the street is you do too. So you’ve been petitioning with your boss for beer breaks instead of smoke breaks, and trying to get a tap handle installed in the lunch room. There’s nothing wrong with that. That’s thinking outside the box right? 

Here at Rough Draft, we like to reward that forward thinking with handcrafted beers that are as unique in character as those who drink it. We favor style over perfection and take joy in sharing our great-tasting creations with those who simply love to try new beer. 

The beers that prove to be winners in our tasting room will be the ones we put into distribution.

data.description: A golden full bodied DIPA layered with resiny aroma and a hint of citrus flavor.

breweries.name: Ithaca Beer Company
breweries.description:
Ithaca Beer Co.,established in 1998, has a mission to brew delicious beers for the purpose of making life more enjoyable. We strive to make this company better and build our brand name and good reputation among our customers.

Over the last decade we have worked hard doing just that, and we have had lots of fun in the process!  From our friendly staff to the award-winning beer to our community outreach, Ithaca Beer continues to brew beers for the purpose of making your simple moments worthwhile.  Take a moment to look around our brand new site and learn about more about Ithaca Beer as a company, the beers we brew, and our involvement in Ithaca, NY.

breweries.name: Persephone Brewing Company
breweries.description: Beer, Farm Fresh. Persephone’s 11-acre farm-based brewery prides itself on the FRESHEST BEER. We grow our own hops and use BC grain in every sip. Not content with simply making the best and freshest beer, Persephone is committed to making the world a better place through early adoption of ecologically positive systems and working as a social venture to employ people who need it most. Every can, glass, growler or keg you purchase helps us achieve these goals as a team, which now includes YOU! Thank you for your support and ENJOY THIS BEER!

breweries.name: Newburyport Brewing Company
breweries.description: Founded in 2012, the Company is Massachusetts' only exclusive all-can and keg craft brewery. Co-founded by two local Newburyport entrepreneurs, musicians, and home brewers - Chris Webb and Bill Fisher - the company aims to capture the essence of Newburyport's quaint seaside character across a line of great tasting handcrafted ales. Newburyport Brewing Company uses premium quality natural ingredients in its Newburyport Pale Ale™, Plum Island Belgian White™, Green Head IPA™ and 1635 Series™ beers.

style.name: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
style.description: Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma. Alcohol content is medium-high to high and notably evident. Though the hop character is intense it's balanced with complex alcohol flavors, moderate to high fruity esters and medium to high malt character. breweries.name: Bike Dog Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Bike Dog Brewing Company is co-founded by four Sacramentans with a love for bikes, dogs and craft beer. The brewers fell in love with the endless flavor profiles available through brewing and the delicate hop profiles only available in incredibly fresh beer and want to share that love with beer drinkers from all over the Sacramento area.

Bike Dog is West Sacramento’s first brewery and the only one in town with a tasting room. We operate a 3 barrel brewhouse (industry speak for really small) on site. Brewing small batches means the beer will always be amazingly fresh and allows for the flexibility to mix it up a little with new recipes getting brewed on a regular basis. Because it will be brewed in such small batches, much of the beer will be available only for purchase in the Bike Dog tasting room — allowing customers to see the beer go from grain to glass and hobnob with the brewers and allowing the brewers to personally nurture the local craft beer community.

breweries.name: Garage Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
We are a state-of-the art 10 BBL brewery and fast casual restaurant in an old automotive center at the end of Old Town Front Street in Temecula. 
 
The brewery equipment was manufacured in North America by a company that has built over 350 breweries and has over 25 years of experience in the craft brewing industry. This customized equipment allows us to make truly exceptional beer with a high level of consistency. 

Equipment doesn’t begin and end in the brew house. An often-overlooked main ingredient in beer is the water. Often brewers will believe that their local water source adds to their individuality of their product, or what wine makers call terroir. While this may be true to a large extent it overlooks the importance of a beer style’s original water source when trying to replicate a specific style.  Without our Reverse Osmosis water filtration system we feel that producing a beer originating from a region with “soft” water just wouldn’t bring that beer justice, being that our own regional water is extremely hard.  Reverse Osmosis gives us flexibility and allows us to properly pay respect and more accurately replicate brewing traditions from all over the world.
 
Our brewing system also wouldn’t be complete without putting thought into the storage of our beer. Many fantastic beers leave breweries and then suffer the consequences of entering the distribution chain that wasn’t at all designed to deal with craft beer. At Garage Brewing Co, we choose our guest beer that has been handled with the utmost care, and we store our own beer just steps from where it was brewed and fermented. Our 10 BBL serving vessels ensure beer delivery in its freshest form and our draft/tap system is highly engineered to ensure that we can pour our guests a proper pint.

Many hours of thought and years of experience have been drawn from to ensure that Garage Brewing Co not only produces and serves and exceptional beer to its guests but does so in a way that respects the old world traditions.

breweries.name: Perrin Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located 10 minutes north of downtown Grand Rapids, Michigan, our micro brewery and taproom is striving to bring a world class experience to every person who walks through our doors.

With a hospitality philosophy of treating our customers like they're guests in our home, we look forward to serving you.

data.name: Double IPA #1
data.description:
Say hello to the first release of our IPA series, Double IPA #1!
This 9% ABV brew is full of Cascade, Simcoe and Mosaic hops. Complex and refreshing, this brew has a piney and herbal aroma. Tropical fruit and berry mesh with citrus notes to create a well-rounded profile.
What is the IPA Series? This series will give you not 1, not 2, not 3… but 4 new IPAs each year!

breweries.name: Weyerbacher Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Established in 1995, Weyerbacher Brewing Company, Inc. was founded in the historic city of Easton, Pennsylvania. We bring artistry, mischief and adventure to the world of brewing so every Weyerbacher beer is an incredible experience.

We, the brewers of Weyerbacher, are continually pushing the envelope of taste experiences, obliterating style guidelines and having a blast while we're at it! Cheers!

data.name: Double IPA #2
data.description: Double IPA #2, featuring Waimea, Wai-iti and Galaxy hops, comes in at 9% ABV and is in the 70 IBU range. A little more bitter than the first in the series, this citrusy brew has mandarin, lime zest and tropical notes.

breweries.name: Weyerbacher Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Established in 1995, Weyerbacher Brewing Company, Inc. was founded in the historic city of Easton, Pennsylvania. We bring artistry, mischief and adventure to the world of brewing so every Weyerbacher beer is an incredible experience.

We, the brewers of Weyerbacher, are continually pushing the envelope of taste experiences, obliterating style guidelines and having a blast while we're at it! Cheers!

data.name: Double IPA (DIPA)
data.description: A well balanced strong beer. We use a very light malt base to showcase the Columbus, Amarillo, and Azacca hops. There's a lot of citrus, grapefruit, and melon in the aroma which leads straight into the taste. Watch out, this is a serious hop Bomb.

style.name: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
style.description: Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma. Alcohol content is medium-high to high and notably evident. They range from deep golden to medium copper in color. The style may use any variety of hops. Though the hop character is intense it's balanced with complex alcohol flavors, moderate to high fruity esters and medium to high malt character. Hop character should be fresh and lively and should not be harsh in quality. The use of large amounts of hops may cause a degree of appropriate hop haze. Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have medium-high to full body. Diacetyl should not be perceived. The intention of this style of beer is to exhibit the fresh and bright character of hops. Oxidative character and aged character should not be present.

breweries.name: Powell Street Craft Brewery
breweries.description: Powell Street Craft Brewery is a nano-brewery focused on producing high quality full flavoured handcrafted beers using all natural, and preferably, local ingredients. The brewery is located at 1830 Powell Street just west of Victoria Drive in an area that is quickly becoming Vancouver's "Brewery District".

data.name: Double IPA - BJ's Brewmaster's Reserve
data.description: BJ’s Brewmaster’s Reserve™ is a line of proprietary craft beers made with premium ingredients and bolder taste profiles.  A robust IPA with smooth drinkability, the Double IPA has a pronounced hop character with fruity, earthy notes.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

breweries.name: BJ's Restaurant and Brewery
breweries.description:
To brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

At BJ's we recognize that brewing is both an art and a science.

We also respect the vast variety of beer styles that the world has to offer - from the delicate balance of German Kolsch to the robust intensity of Russian Imperial Stout.

Our Passionate and talented team of brewers strives toward one simple goal: to brew consistently great beer in a variety of ale and lager styles. That's really what BJ's beer is all about.

breweries.name: Obed and Isaac's
breweries.description: It all about the freshest and best in local beer, great food and top service. This all happens at Obed and Isaac's Microbrewery & Eatery. Directly across the street from the President Lincoln's home and neighborhood.

data.name: Double IPA No. 2
data.description: Intensely hoppy and dangerously drinkable. Tropical and dank with a malt backbone to balance the bitterness.

breweries.name: Station 26 Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Denver fire station turned brewery + taproom

5280's 2014 "Best New Brewery" 

Westword's 2014 "Best Taproom - Ambience"

data.name: Double IPL
data.description: This beer is not a Double India Pale Ale….however that is the closest “style” selection this web site offers.  Our Double IPL is brewed big and bold with two-row Moravian barley, grown in the San Luis Valley and malted in-house. This beer is then infused with hops, born and bathed in Rocky Mountain sunshine. Our Double IPL brings a free spirit home, with a crisp, clean, hoppy flavor, passionately crafted just for you. Colorado Native Lagers are brewed with 100% Colorado grown ingredients. The majority of the barley used to brew other beers in Colorado comes from out-of-state malt houses and the majority of the hops used to brew other beers in Colorado come from Europe and the Pacific Northwest. Colorado Native Lagers are Colorado’s “homegrown” beers.

style.name: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale
style.description: Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma. Alcohol content is medium-high to high and notably evident. They range from deep golden to medium copper in color. The style may use any variety of hops. Though the hop character is intense it's balanced with complex alcohol flavors, moderate to high fruity esters and medium to high malt character. Hop character should be fresh and lively and should not be harsh in quality. The use of large amounts of hops may cause a degree of appropriate hop haze. Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have medium-high to full body. Diacetyl should not be perceived. The intention of this style of beer is to exhibit the fresh and bright character of hops. Oxidative character and aged character should not be present.

breweries.name: AC Golden Brewing Company
breweries.description: The AC Golden Brewing Company is a subsidiary of MillerCoors, a joint venture between SABMiller and Molson Coors Brewing Company. Its purpose is to serve as a specialty brewing arm of MillerCoors, in the words of president Glenn Knippenberg, "Our mission for AC Golden is to be a brand incubator for what is now MillerCoors". The AC Golden Brewery operates in the former pilot brewery of the Coors Brewery. It debuted its first beer, Herman Joseph's Private Reserve, in 2008. The company began brewing its seasonal beer, a Vienna Style lager called Winterfest, in 2009. In April 2010, AC Golden introduced Colorado Native Amber Lager in Colorado, an amber lager made with 100% Colorado ingredients. In 2014 the brewery introduced Colorado Native India Pale Lager. In 2015 Colorado Native Golden Lager was introduced, along with Colorado Native Double IPL, Colorado Native Saison, Colorado Native Olathe Lager, Colorado Native Oktoberfest and Colorado Native Winterfest.

data.name: Double Jack
data.description: Double Jack IPA is our first ever Imperial IPA. It features a big malty middle to cloak the high alcohol and mouth puckering hop bitterness. Huge tangerine, grapefruit and juicy fruit aroma blossom over the herbal blue basil and malt earthiness of this aggressive beer. Best enjoyed in moderation.

breweries.name: Firestone Walker Brewing Company
breweries.description: Founded in 1996 by Adam Firestone (aka the Bear) & David Walker (aka the Lion), Firestone Walker Brewing Company began as a small brewery with roots in wine country on California’s Central Coast. Now a regional brewery, our singular purpose remains – to craft ever better beer.  Passionately in pursuit of the perfect beer…and never satisfied.

breweries.name: La Souche
breweries.description:
Inspirée des racines québécoises, La Souche ramène à l’essence, rappelle les cabanes à sucre, les camps de chasse où les hommes festoyaient à grandes goulées. Accoudés aux tables rondes découpées à même l’arbre, La Souche vous invite aux découvertes brassicoles dans une ambiance feutrée et chaleureuse.
﻿
Influencée par les produits locaux, notre cuisine s’inspire des pubs tout en intégrant la bière au menu. Dans une philosophie de développement local et durable, La Souche se veut un lieu culturel où les esprits assoiffés de qualité se rencontrent!
​
Nos bières artisanales sont inspirées des styles classiques anglais, écossais, belge, allemand et américain. Notre brasseur et ses acolytes travaillent avec des ingrédients du terroir afin de développer le style québécois.
